results.firPara: Liverpools Roberto Firmino was targeted by burglars less than two days before the Brazilian was arrested and charged with drink-driving, local police have confirmed.
results.secPara: The Liverpool Echo have reported that Firminos house, in the Mossley Hill area of the city, was burgled on 22 December by a gang who stole £70,000 worth of items. Firmino and his family were moved to a hotel, with the club later placing a security team at the home.
results.webTitle: Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino has house burgled by gang

results.firPara: A Swedish court has found the former head coach of the countrys athletics team guilty of aggravated libel against Manchester Uniteds Zlatan Ibrahimovic for suggesting the footballer used performance-enhancing substances.
results.secPara: The district court in Karlstad ordered Ulf Karlsson to pay a fine of SKr24,000 (£2,170) for comments he made at a panel discussion at a sports conference in April. Karlsson implied Ibrahimovic, 35, must have used substances to bulk up as quickly as he had done during his time at Juventus.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic wins libel case against athletics coach over doping claim

results.firPara: Phil Thompson thinks Hulls appointment of Marco Silva is astonishing, baffling and embarrassing but why would any club promote an Englishman?
results.secPara: Phil Thompson thinks Hulls appointment of Marco Silva is astonishing, baffling and embarrassing but why would any club promote an Englishman?
results.webTitle: Do English managers deserve more chances in the Premier League? | Paul Campbell

results.firPara: Not for the first time, Papu Gómezs biceps stole the show. The Atalanta captain has made headlines all season with his unconventional armband designs. First there was the Mothers Day tribute, then the Spiderman logo, the Holly & Benji cartoon and, most famously, a celebration of Pro Evolution Soccers original Master League XI. As Serie A returned to action on Sunday, he unveiled a new design, inspired by the movie Frozen.
results.secPara: It was chosen to mark his daughter Constantinas second birthday, with her face appearing alongside those of Anna, Elsa and Olaf. But he might unintentionally have also captured the spirit of the footballing moment. Frozen was a fitting theme for a weekend when one game – Pescara v Fiorentina – was snowed off, while the status quo at the top of the table was perfectly preserved.
results.webTitle: Atalanta captain Papu Gómez leads by example as his club let young talent go

results.firPara: • League One club chairman blames recent run of results
results.secPara: Northampton Town have sacked their manager Rob Page. The League One club made the announcement on Monday morning following controversial post-match comments made at the weekend by Page following the defeat at Bristol Rovers.
results.webTitle: Northampton sack manager Rob Page after controversial post-defeat comment

results.firPara: Plymouths defence was classy and defiant, Ndidi excelled on Leicester debut, Batshuayi proved little and Stourbridge showed romance is alive, even in defeat
results.secPara: Plymouths defence was classy and defiant, Ndidi excelled on Leicester debut, Batshuayi proved little and Stourbridge showed romance is alive, even in defeat

results.firPara: Pilgrims fan and comedian Josh Widdicombe documents his FA Cup awayday at Anfield alongside more than 8,500 Plymouth Argyle supporters
results.secPara: It may be easy for me to say this straight after the match but that was the greatest experience Ive ever had supporting Plymouth Argyle. I presumed it would be the same for everyone who saw the game but having spoken to some friends I now realise I am out of step with the nation. In reality, it was almost certainly an absolutely awful football match. But, frankly, who cares?
results.webTitle: Anfield draw was my greatest experience as a Plymouth fan – but pure pain | Josh Widdicombe

results.firPara: Eddie Howe has admitted Bournemouths record signing Jordon Ibe has been a disappointment and blamed the large number of summer arrivals for his sides failure to progress in the FA Cup.
results.secPara: Bournemouth comprehensively lost their third-round tie at League One Millwall 3-0 on Saturday after making 11 changes to the team that played the previous league fixture. Afterwards Howe said he had been excited by the line-up he selected, but admitted they had failed to perform.
results.webTitle: Bournemouth manager Eddie Howe calls Jordon Ibe a ‘disappointment’

results.firPara: Sam Allardyce left his imprint on Bolton, just as they shaped him, but as he returned to one club he both played for and managed, he suggested he will instead borrow his blueprint from another. A decade ago, he threatened to take Bolton into the top four. Extricating Sunderland from the bottom three last season has more pertinence to his current plight, however, and he hopes history will repeat itself 300 miles further south and 12 months later.
results.secPara: January proved pivotal in his Sunderland salvage bid. Allardyce is again targeting upgrades at Crystal Palace, wondering how many ways he can split his budget without quantity replacing quality, and confounding the orthodox wisdom that striking additions are crucial at this time of year.
results.webTitle: Sam Allardyce looks to stiffen Crystal Palace’s defensive resolve
